Massachusetts Attorney General - Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division

incorporation_agency: Massachusetts Secretary of the Commonwealth - Corporations Division
charitable_registration_agency: Massachusetts Attorney General - Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross revenue under $5,000 annually may be exempt from registration, but must still file IRS Form 990-N (e-postcard) with AG. Organizations under $50,000 may file simplified registration.

formation_requirements.notes: Massachusetts requires a resident agent with a Massachusetts address. Filing fee of $35 is affordable. Massachusetts uses 'Articles of Organization' rather than 'Articles of Incorporation.'

requirements.filing_agency: Massachusetts Secretary of the Commonwealth - Corporations Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by November 1st of each year for all entities regardless of formation date
required_information: Names and addresses of directors and officers
requirements.notes: Filing fee is $15 online. All nonprofits must file by November 1st regardless of fiscal year. Late fee of $100 applies after deadline.

requirements.filing_agency: Massachusetts Attorney General - Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division
requirements.form_number: Form PC - Registration of Public Charities
required_information: List of officers, directors, and trustees
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Initial registration is free. Required before soliciting in Massachusetts. Organizations with revenue under $5,000 are exempt but must file 990-N with AG.

requirements.filing_agency: Massachusetts Attorney General - Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end (or by extended IRS deadline)
requirements.form_number: Form PC - Annual Report of Public Charities
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual filing is free with no late fees. Organizations with revenue under $50,000 may file simplified Form PC-SF. Failure to file may result in enforcement action.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form ST-2 - Sales Tax Exempt Purchaser Certificate and Form ST-5 - Exempt Organization Certificate
requirements.notes: Massachusetts provides sales tax exemption for qualifying 501(c)(3) organizations. Use Form ST-2 for exempt purchases. Not all purchases are exempt - review specific exemptions.

requirements.due_date_specifics: File by March 1st for exemption beginning the following January 1st
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
Documentation of public benefit and charity to the poor
requirements.notes: Massachusetts has strict charitable exemption requirements including 'charity to indigent persons.' Property must be used exclusively for charitable purposes. Once granted, exemption continues if use remains qualifying.

requirements.filing_agency: Local Licensing Authority (City/Town Clerk or License Commission)
requirements.due_date_specifics: File application at least 30 days before event
required_information: Proof of incorporation or registration in Massachusetts
requirements.notes: Massachusetts allows raffles and bazaars for qualified nonprofits. Local licensing authority approval required. Prize limit $25,000 per raffle. Annual limit varies by municipality.

required_information: Proof of 2+ years operation in Massachusetts
List of officers and gaming managers
requirements.notes: Required for bingo and other charitable gaming beyond raffles. Organization must be in existence for 2+ years. Quarterly reporting required.

requirements.filing_agency: Massachusetts Attorney General - Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional solicitors. Registration is free but bond required. Each contract must be filed. Campaign reports required within 90 days of completion.

requirements.filing_agency: Massachusetts Attorney General - Non-Profit Organizations/Public Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting but does not solicit or handle contributions. Registration is free. No bond required. Each contract must be filed.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and included in Form PC if required
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (completed before Form PC due)
requirements.notes: Massachusetts requires audited financial statements for organizations with gross revenue over $500,000. Organizations should also follow any audit requirements in their bylaws or funding agreements.

special_notes.november_first_deadline: All Massachusetts nonprofits must file corporate annual reports by November 1st regardless of fiscal year or formation date. This is different from most states.
special_notes.charity_to_poor_requirement: Massachusetts property tax exemption has strict requirements including demonstrating 'charity to indigent persons.' This is more restrictive than many states.
special_notes.low_threshold: Massachusetts has a very low $5,000 exemption threshold for charitable registration. Most organizations must register.
special_notes.free_charity_filing: Charitable registration and annual reports are free in Massachusetts, which helps offset the low threshold and strict requirements.
special_notes.board_requirements: Massachusetts nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Massachusetts residents.
special_notes.two_year_gaming: Massachusetts requires 2 years of operation before charitable gaming (bingo), which is shorter than some states but still a barrier.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_reports: Professional solicitors must file campaign reports within 90 days of campaign completion, providing detailed financial information.
special_notes.audit_threshold: Massachusetts audit threshold is $500,000 in gross revenue, which is mid-range compared to other states.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes. Attorney General must approve dissolution plans for registered charities.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and Massachusetts Corporate Excise Return if conducting business in Massachusetts.
special_notes.articles_of_organization: Massachusetts uses 'Articles of Organization' terminology rather than 'Articles of Incorporation' used in most states.
special_notes.local_raffle_variation: Raffle regulations vary significantly by municipality. Contact local licensing authority for specific requirements and limits.
